com.st.st25sdk.command

Class Type2Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.st25sdk.command.Type2Command
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Type2CommandInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NdefType2Command

    public class Type2Command
extends java.lang.Object
implements Type2CommandInterface
    Defines methods to build all the NFC Forum Type2 commands

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_NBR_OF_BLOCKS_PER_READ
      Block number default value for Type2 read command (in blocks)
      static int DEFAULT_NBR_OF_BLOCKS_PER_WRITE
      Block number default value for Type2 write command (in block)
      static int DEFAULT_NBR_OF_BYTES_PER_BLOCK
      Block size default value for Type2 (in bytes)
      static int DEFAULT_SECTOR_SIZE_IN_BLOCKS
      Sector size default value for Type2 (in blocks)
      protected int mBlockSizeInBytes 
      protected int mNumberOfReadBlocks 
      protected int mNumberOfWriteBlocks 
      static int NFC_TYPE2_ACK
      Type2 ACK response (4-bit data 1010)
      protected RFReaderInterface.TransceiveMode transceiveMode 
      static byte TYPE2_CMD_READ
      Type2 read 16-byte instruction code
      static byte TYPE2_CMD_SECTOR_SELECT
      Type2 Sector Select Command packet 1 instruction code
      static byte TYPE2_CMD_WRITE
      Type2 write 4-byte instruction code

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void checkType2Response(byte[] response)
      This function checks a command response and raises a STException in case of error
      protected void generateNackException(byte[] response) 
      int getBlockSize()
      This function returns the number of byte in a block
      int getReadDataSize()
      This function returns the number of bytes that are used by a read command
      int getWriteDataSize()
      This function returns the number of byte that are used by a write command
      byte[] read(byte blockNumber)
      Read command, used to read data from type2 Tag Type2 read command send back 4 blocks (16 bytes) from blockNumber address
      byte[] readBlocks(int firstBlockAddress, int sizeInBlocks)
      High level blocks read function for Type2 tags This function allows to read several blocks
      byte[] readBytes(int byteAddress, int nbOfBytesToRead)
      High level bytes read function for Type2 tags This function allows to read one or more bytes even if they are not in the same block
      byte[] sectorSelect(byte sectorNumber)
      Select sector command packet 2 used to address physical memory bigger than 1KB (1024 Bytes) in type2 tag
      byte[] sectorSelectCmdPacket1()
      Sector Select Command Packet 1 used initiate Sector Select command in type2 tag
      byte[] sectorSelectCmdPacket2(byte sectorNumber)
      Sector Select Command Packet 2 used to address physical memory bigger than 1KB (1024 Bytes) in type2 tag
      byte[] transceive(java.lang.String commandName, byte[] data)
      Sends the RF frame to the reader and checks the command status If transceiveMode is set as iso14443-A transparent mode, the RF frame response is sent as it, event id Tag send back an error code
      byte[] write(byte blockNumber, byte[] data)
      Write command, used to write data to the selected file
      void writeBlocks(int firstBlockAddress, byte[] data)
      High level blocks write function for Type2 tags This function allows to write several blocks
      void writeBytes(int byteAddress, byte[] data)
      High level byte write function for Type2 tags This function allows to write one or more bytes inside blocks even if they are not in the same block The function reads the blocks to be modify, change the bytes to be written then write the blocks

      • Type2Command

        public Type2Command(RFReaderInterface reader,
                    int blockSize,
                    int numberOfReadBlocks,
                    int numberOfWriteBlocks)
        Constructor for a Type2Command object
        Parameters:
        reader - the reader interface object to be used to send the commands
        blockSize - block size in bytes
        numberOfReadBlocks - data size for read command
        numberOfWriteBlocks - data size for write command

      • read

        public byte[] read(byte blockNumber)
            throws STException
        Read command, used to read data from type2 Tag Type2 read command send back 4 blocks (16 bytes) from blockNumber address
        Specified by:
        read in interface Type2CommandInterface
        Parameters:
        blockNumber - address to read the 4 blocks (16 bytes)
        Returns:
        the received response
        Throws:
        STException

        Parameters:

        data - Data to be written

      • sectorSelectCmdPacket1

        public byte[] sectorSelectCmdPacket1()
                              throws STException
        Sector Select Command Packet 1 used initiate Sector Select command in type2 tag
        Specified by:
        sectorSelectCmdPacket1 in interface Type2CommandInterface
        Returns:
        tag's response (ACK response if some sectors can be selected, NACK response else)
        Throws:
        STException

      • sectorSelectCmdPacket2

        public byte[] sectorSelectCmdPacket2(byte sectorNumber)
                              throws STException
        Sector Select Command Packet 2 used to address physical memory bigger than 1KB (1024 Bytes) in type2 tag
        Specified by:
        sectorSelectCmdPacket2 in interface Type2CommandInterface
        Parameters:
        sectorNumber - sector number from 0x00 to 0xFE (0xFF is RFU)
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • readBlocks

        public byte[] readBlocks(int firstBlockAddress,
                         int sizeInBlocks)
                  throws STException
        High level blocks read function for Type2 tags This function allows to read several blocks
        Parameters:
        firstBlockAddress - Address of the first block to read
        sizeInBlocks - Number of blocks to be read
        Returns:
        read blocks
        Throws:
        STException

      • readBytes

        public byte[] readBytes(int byteAddress,
                        int nbOfBytesToRead)
                 throws STException
        High level bytes read function for Type2 tags This function allows to read one or more bytes even if they are not in the same block
        Parameters:
        byteAddress - Address of the first byte to read
        nbOfBytesToRead - Number of bytes to be read
        Returns:
        read bytes
        Throws:
        STException

      • writeBlocks

        public void writeBlocks(int firstBlockAddress,
                        byte[] data)
                 throws STException
        High level blocks write function for Type2 tags This function allows to write several blocks
        Parameters:
        firstBlockAddress - Address of the first block to written
        data - Data to be written
        Throws:
        STException

      • writeBytes

        public void writeBytes(int byteAddress,
                       byte[] data)
                throws STException
        High level byte write function for Type2 tags This function allows to write one or more bytes inside blocks even if they are not in the same block The function reads the blocks to be modify, change the bytes to be written then write the blocks
        Parameters:
        byteAddress - Address of the first byte to update
        data - Data to be update
        Throws:
        STException

        Throws:

      • transceive

        public byte[] transceive(java.lang.String commandName,
                         byte[] data)
                  throws STException
        Sends the RF frame to the reader and checks the command status If transceiveMode is set as iso14443-A transparent mode, the RF frame response is sent as it, event id Tag send back an error code
        Parameters:
        commandName - name of the command
        data - the RF frame to be sent
        Returns:
        the RF response frame sent back by the tag
        Throws:
        STException
